definition: bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
nest/pit or hollow on the human body/lair/den/place/to harbor or shelter/to hold in check/to bend/classifier for litters and broods

sentences.english: In those days without you, just like the nest of coffee without sugar bitter.
sentences.chinese: 在那段沒有你的日子裏，就像鳥窩咖啡沒加糖一樣苦。

sentences.english: The bird hovered over its nest.
sentences.chinese: 這鳥在它的鳥窩上空盤旋。

sentences.english: Preliminary estimates put the number of birds' nests there at over 20000.
sentences.chinese: 初步估計那裏的鳥窩有兩萬多個。

sentences.english: The verdant pines remember the first time she wanted to rob a bird's nest.
sentences.chinese: 那些蒼翠的松樹記着查利雲第一次想去掏鳥窩。

sentences.english: Clare ismaking a huge sculpture out of tiny wisps of purple paper; it looks like across between a Muppet and a bird’s nest.
sentences.chinese: 那雕像看起來象一個提線木偶，又象個鳥窩。

definition: to trust one another fully/to treat sb with sincerity
"The Ugly Duckling" by Hans Christian Andersen 安徒生[An1 tu2 sheng1]
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
see 驢唇不對馬嘴|驴唇不对马嘴[lu:2 chun2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3]
pinyin: niu2 tou2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3

definition: lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
grinning from ear to ear (idiom)/beaming with happiness
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
